# <a name="cc0-10-universal"></a><span data-ttu-id="824a8-974">CC0 1.0 通用</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-974">CC0 1.0 Universal</span></span>

## <a name="statement-of-purpose"></a><span data-ttu-id="824a8-975">目标声明</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-975">Statement of Purpose</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-976">世界各地大多数区域的法律将自动在 authorship 和/或数据库的原始工作的创建者和后续所有者（每个和全部，一种 "工作"）中授予独占版权和相关权利（定义如下）。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-976">The laws of most jurisdictions throughout the world automatically confer exclusive Copyright and Related Rights (defined below) upon the creator and subsequent owner(s) (each and all, an “owner”) of an original work of authorship and/or a database (each, a “Work”).</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-977">某些所有者希望永久放弃这些权限，以使其能够可靠且无需担心后续的侵害性生成的 commons （"Commons"），而无需担心后续的侵害性、修改、合并其他作品、重用和重新发布，以供任何目的的任何形式随意使用，从而永久放弃这些工作，包括但不限于商业用途。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-977">Certain owners wish to permanently relinquish those rights to a Work for the purpose of contributing to a commons of creative, cultural and scientific works (“Commons”) that the public can reliably and without fear of later claims of infringement build upon, modify, incorporate in other works, reuse and redistribute as freely as possible in any form whatsoever and for any purposes, including without limitation commercial purposes.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-978">这些所有者可能会参与 Commons，以促进自由文化的理想之选，并进一步改进创新性、文化和科学的工作，或者通过使用和使用其他人员来获取其工作的信誉或更大的分布。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-978">These owners may contribute to the Commons to promote the ideal of a free culture and the further production of creative, cultural and scientific works, or to gain reputation or greater distribution for their Work in part through the use and efforts of others.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-979">对于这些和/或其他目的和动机，无需任何其他考虑或补偿的预期，将 CC0 与工作（"Affirmer"）相关联的人是其在工作中的版权和相关权限的所有者，自愿自愿将 CC0 应用于工作，并在其条款中公开分配工作，并了解工作的版权和相关权利，以及 CC0 对这些权利的意义和预期法律影响。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-979">For these and/or other purposes and motivations, and without any expectation of additional consideration or compensation, the person associating CC0 with a Work (the “Affirmer”), to the extent that he or she is an owner of Copyright and Related Rights in the Work, voluntarily elects to apply CC0 to the Work and publicly distribute the Work under its terms, with knowledge of his or her Copyright and Related Rights in the Work and the meaning and intended legal effect of CC0 on those rights.</span></span>

1. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-980">版权和相关权利。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-980">Copyright and Related Rights.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-981">在 CC0 下提供的工作可能受到版权和相关或邻近权限（"版权和相关权利"）的保护。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-981">A Work made available under CC0 may be protected by copyright and related or neighboring rights (“Copyright and Related Rights”).</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-982">版权和相关权限包括（但不限于）以下各项：</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-982">Copyright and Related Rights include, but are not limited to, the following:</span></span>
   1. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-983">复制、修改、分发、执行、显示、传达和翻译工作的权利;</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-983">the right to reproduce, adapt, distribute, perform, display, communicate, and translate a Work;</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1080">某些所有者希望永久放弃这些权限，以使其能够可靠且无需担心后续的侵害性生成的 commons （"Commons"），而无需担心后续的侵害性、修改、合并其他作品、重用和重新发布，以供任何目的的任何形式随意使用，从而永久放弃这些工作，包括但不限于商业用途。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1080">Certain owners wish to permanently relinquish those rights to a Work for the purpose of contributing to a commons of creative, cultural and scientific works (“Commons”) that the public can reliably and without fear of later claims of infringement build upon, modify, incorporate in other works, reuse and redistribute as freely as possible in any form whatsoever and for any purposes, including without limitation commercial purposes.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1081">这些所有者可能会参与 Commons，以促进自由文化的理想之选，并进一步改进创新性、文化和科学的工作，或者通过使用和使用其他人员来获取其工作的信誉或更大的分布。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1081">These owners may contribute to the Commons to promote the ideal of a free culture and the further production of creative, cultural and scientific works, or to gain reputation or greater distribution for their Work in part through the use and efforts of others.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1082">对于这些和/或其他目的和动机，无需任何其他考虑或补偿的预期，将 CC0 与工作（"Affirmer"）相关联的人是其在工作中的版权和相关权限的所有者，自愿自愿将 CC0 应用于工作，并在其条款中公开分配工作，并了解工作的版权和相关权利，以及 CC0 对这些权利的意义和预期法律影响。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1082">For these and/or other purposes and motivations, and without any expectation of additional consideration or compensation, the person associating CC0 with a Work (the “Affirmer”), to the extent that he or she is an owner of Copyright and Related Rights in the Work, voluntarily elects to apply CC0 to the Work and publicly distribute the Work under its terms, with knowledge of his or her Copyright and Related Rights in the Work and the meaning and intended legal effect of CC0 on those rights.</span></span>

1. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1083">版权和相关权利。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1083">Copyright and Related Rights.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1084">在 CC0 下提供的工作可能受到版权和相关或邻近权限（"版权和相关权利"）的保护。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1084">A Work made available under CC0 may be protected by copyright and related or neighboring rights (“Copyright and Related Rights”).</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1085">版权和相关权限包括（但不限于）以下各项：</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1085">Copyright and Related Rights include, but are not limited to, the following:</span></span>
   1. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1086">复制、修改、分发、执行、显示、传达和翻译工作的权利;</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1086">the right to reproduce, adapt, distribute, perform, display, communicate, and translate a Work;</span></span>
   2. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1087">原作者和/或执行者保留的道德权利;</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1087">moral rights retained by the original author(s) and/or performer(s);</span></span>
   3. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1088">有关工作中所描述的人员的图像或 likeness 的公开和隐私权利;</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1088">publicity and privacy rights pertaining to a person’s image or likeness depicted in a Work;</span></span>
   4. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1089">针对工作的不公平竞争的权限保护，受限于段落4（i）中的限制，如下所示。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1089">rights protecting against unfair competition in regards to a Work, subject to the limitations in paragraph 4(i), below;</span></span>
   5. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1090">保护在工作中提取、分发、使用和重复使用数据的权限;</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1090">rights protecting the extraction, dissemination, use and reuse of data in a Work;</span></span>
   6. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1091">数据库权限（例如，在欧洲 Parliament 和11月11日的委员会1996年3月11日的委员会年3月11日的委员会中，在任何国家/地区的实施中，包括此类指令的任何修订版本或后续任务版本）;并</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1091">database rights (such as those arising under Directive 96/9/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 11 March 1996 on the legal protection of databases, and under any national implementation thereof, including any amended or successor version of such directive); and</span></span>
   7. <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1092">基于适用法律或条约的全球范围内的其他类似、等效或相应权限，以及任何国家/地区实现。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1092">other similar, equivalent or corresponding rights throughout the world based on applicable law or treaty, and any national implementations thereof.</span></span>

# <a name="cc0-10-universal"></a><span data-ttu-id="824a8-1323">CC0 1.0 通用</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1323">CC0 1.0 Universal</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1485">世界各地大多数区域的法律将自动在 authorship 和/或数据库的原始工作的创建者和后续所有者（每个和全部，一种 "工作"）中授予独占版权和相关权利（定义如下）。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1485">The laws of most jurisdictions throughout the world automatically confer exclusive Copyright and Related Rights (defined below) upon the creator and subsequent owner(s) (each and all, an “owner”) of an original work of authorship and/or a database (each, a “Work”).</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1486">某些所有者希望永久放弃这些权限，以使其能够可靠且无需担心后续的侵害性生成的 commons （"Commons"），而无需担心后续的侵害性、修改、合并其他作品、重用和重新发布，以供任何目的的任何形式随意使用，从而永久放弃这些工作，包括但不限于商业用途。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1486">Certain owners wish to permanently relinquish those rights to a Work for the purpose of contributing to a commons of creative, cultural and scientific works (“Commons”) that the public can reliably and without fear of later claims of infringement build upon, modify, incorporate in other works, reuse and redistribute as freely as possible in any form whatsoever and for any purposes, including without limitation commercial purposes.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1487">这些所有者可能会参与 Commons，以促进自由文化的理想之选，并进一步改进创新性、文化和科学的工作，或者通过使用和使用其他人员来获取其工作的信誉或更大的分布。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1487">These owners may contribute to the Commons to promote the ideal of a free culture and the further production of creative, cultural and scientific works, or to gain reputation or greater distribution for their Work in part through the use and efforts of others.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1488">对于这些和/或其他目的和动机，无需任何其他考虑或补偿的预期，将 CC0 与工作（"Affirmer"）相关联的人是其在工作中的版权和相关权限的所有者，自愿自愿将 CC0 应用于工作，并在其条款中公开分配工作，并了解工作的版权和相关权利，以及 CC0 对这些权利的意义和预期法律影响。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1488">For these and/or other purposes and motivations, and without any expectation of additional consideration or compensation, the person associating CC0 with a Work (the “Affirmer”), to the extent that he or she is an owner of Copyright and Related Rights in the Work, voluntarily elects to apply CC0 to the Work and publicly distribute the Work under its terms, with knowledge of his or her Copyright and Related Rights in the Work and the meaning and intended legal effect of CC0 on those rights.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1581">世界各地大多数区域的法律将自动在 authorship 和/或数据库的原始工作的创建者和后续所有者（每个和全部，一种 "工作"）中授予独占版权和相关权利（定义如下）。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1581">The laws of most jurisdictions throughout the world automatically confer exclusive Copyright and Related Rights (defined below) upon the creator and subsequent owner(s) (each and all, an “owner”) of an original work of authorship and/or a database (each, a “Work”).</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1582">某些所有者希望永久放弃这些权限，以使其能够可靠且无需担心后续的侵害性生成的 commons （"Commons"），而无需担心后续的侵害性、修改、合并其他作品、重用和重新发布，以供任何目的的任何形式随意使用，从而永久放弃这些工作，包括但不限于商业用途。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1582">Certain owners wish to permanently relinquish those rights to a Work for the purpose of contributing to a commons of creative, cultural and scientific works (“Commons”) that the public can reliably and without fear of later claims of infringement build upon, modify, incorporate in other works, reuse and redistribute as freely as possible in any form whatsoever and for any purposes, including without limitation commercial purposes.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1583">这些所有者可能会参与 Commons，以促进自由文化的理想之选，并进一步改进创新性、文化和科学的工作，或者通过使用和使用其他人员来获取其工作的信誉或更大的分布。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1583">These owners may contribute to the Commons to promote the ideal of a free culture and the further production of creative, cultural and scientific works, or to gain reputation or greater distribution for their Work in part through the use and efforts of others.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1584">对于这些和/或其他目的和动机，无需任何其他考虑或补偿的预期，将 CC0 与工作（"Affirmer"）相关联的人是其在工作中的版权和相关权限的所有者，自愿自愿将 CC0 应用于工作，并在其条款中公开分配工作，并了解工作的版权和相关权利，以及 CC0 对这些权利的意义和预期法律影响。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1584">For these and/or other purposes and motivations, and without any expectation of additional consideration or compensation, the person associating CC0 with a Work (the “Affirmer”), to the extent that he or she is an owner of Copyright and Related Rights in the Work, voluntarily elects to apply CC0 to the Work and publicly distribute the Work under its terms, with knowledge of his or her Copyright and Related Rights in the Work and the meaning and intended legal effect of CC0 on those rights.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1677">世界各地大多数区域的法律将自动在 authorship 和/或数据库的原始工作的创建者和后续所有者（每个和全部，一种 "工作"）中授予独占版权和相关权利（定义如下）。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1677">The laws of most jurisdictions throughout the world automatically confer exclusive Copyright and Related Rights (defined below) upon the creator and subsequent owner(s) (each and all, an “owner”) of an original work of authorship and/or a database (each, a “Work”).</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1678">某些所有者希望永久放弃这些权限，以使其能够可靠且无需担心后续的侵害性生成的 commons （"Commons"），而无需担心后续的侵害性、修改、合并其他作品、重用和重新发布，以供任何目的的任何形式随意使用，从而永久放弃这些工作，包括但不限于商业用途。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1678">Certain owners wish to permanently relinquish those rights to a Work for the purpose of contributing to a commons of creative, cultural and scientific works (“Commons”) that the public can reliably and without fear of later claims of infringement build upon, modify, incorporate in other works, reuse and redistribute as freely as possible in any form whatsoever and for any purposes, including without limitation commercial purposes.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1679">这些所有者可能会参与 Commons，以促进自由文化的理想之选，并进一步改进创新性、文化和科学的工作，或者通过使用和使用其他人员来获取其工作的信誉或更大的分布。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1679">These owners may contribute to the Commons to promote the ideal of a free culture and the further production of creative, cultural and scientific works, or to gain reputation or greater distribution for their Work in part through the use and efforts of others.</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1773">世界各地大多数区域的法律将自动在 authorship 和/或数据库的原始工作的创建者和后续所有者（每个和全部，一种 "工作"）中授予独占版权和相关权利（定义如下）。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1773">The laws of most jurisdictions throughout the world automatically confer exclusive Copyright and Related Rights (defined below) upon the creator and subsequent owner(s) (each and all, an “owner”) of an original work of authorship and/or a database (each, a “Work”).</span></span>

<span data-ttu-id="824a8-1774">某些所有者希望永久放弃这些权限，以使其能够可靠且无需担心后续的侵害性生成的 commons （"Commons"），而无需担心后续的侵害性、修改、合并其他作品、重用和重新发布，以供任何目的的任何形式随意使用，从而永久放弃这些工作，包括但不限于商业用途。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1774">Certain owners wish to permanently relinquish those rights to a Work for the purpose of contributing to a commons of creative, cultural and scientific works (“Commons”) that the public can reliably and without fear of later claims of infringement build upon, modify, incorporate in other works, reuse and redistribute as freely as possible in any form whatsoever and for any purposes, including without limitation commercial purposes.</span></span> <span data-ttu-id="824a8-1775">这些所有者可能会参与 Commons，以促进自由文化的理想之选，并进一步改进创新性、文化和科学的工作，或者通过使用和使用其他人员来获取其工作的信誉或更大的分布。</span><span class="sxs-lookup"><span data-stu-id="824a8-1775">These owners may contribute to the Commons to promote the ideal of a free culture and the further production of creative, cultural and scientific works, or to gain reputation or greater distribution for their Work in part through the use and efforts of others.</span></span>
